headline: Fresh Tomato Salsa
description: Finely chopped Serrano chilies make this salsa nippy and nice. Combine with tomatoes, onions, cilantro and lime juice, and this salsa is ready for dipping.

video.description: This authentic salsa is bursting with fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, and lime.
video.name: Fresh Tomato Salsa

name: Fresh Tomato Salsa

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, stir together tomatoes, onion, chili peppers, cilantro, salt, and lime juice. Chill for one hour in the refrigerator before serving.

review.reviewBody: Made this recipe as written for ingredients and pulsed it in a cuisinart blender to chop vegetables a little finer. Everyone, 10 friends and family, gave a 5 stars on the salsa.
These ingredients are growing abundantly in my garden, we've eaten salsa for days and still not tired of it!

This was my first time making salsa. I used different tomatoes from my garden and also fresh green peppers from the garden as well. I followed the recipe to the T except added some garlic powder. It was definitely very good and very fresh but it was a bit lacking in flavor. I did let it sit overnight first. I’ll try fresh garlic next time. Thanks for this recipe!!
Use More tomatoes, less cilantro, add a clove of garlic, use jalapenos and maybe 1 serrano
It is one of my favorite salsa I make. Fresh, light, and tasty. When I make this and bring it to game night or family gatherings when you could have them. People really enjoy it.

It was good starting point for ratio and amount of ingredients. Five Serrano peppers is way yoo much! Used one. Added garlic glove and parsley instead I'll f cilantro. Had red and yellow sweet peppers to add. I doubled the recipe.
I added cumin and garlic powder
Liked it!

I’ve never made salsa before in my life and things to this recipe we have salsa at least once a week and my family are huge fans of this recipe. Thank you so much we love it just the way it is and usually triple the recipe.?
Super delicious. Added one clove of diced garlic and entire family loved it!

I followed this recipe exactly except that I used six tomatoes. Mine were very small and it just needed a lot more tomato. I also added few splashes of Tabasco because Hubby likes his heat. Personally, I would have left the Tabasco out. It is absolutely Delish just as the recipe prescribes if you have large tomatoes. I will most certainly be making this one over and over again. I must confess that I had to make a second batch of this because I couldn't stop eating the first one. It is Soooo darned Good!!!
This salsa is amazing. I add fresh everything but I do add a half of can of rotel and a bit of fresh garlic. Perfect!!!
I changed it a bit, but it was great.

I made this with my mom, and it was really fun. It's simple and easy, but still really good. I left out the peppers, because I do not like spice and can't handle it that well, but the lime and salt still brought a nice flavor to the salsa. I also used the recommendation from another review to use a minced clove of garlic, which is a nice touch. I realized that there wasn't much though, but soon realized I used Roma tomatoes instead of the normal ones. Despite the ratio being a bit off, it still tasted fantastic.
No change, will make again.

Great recipe! I left out the chiles since I was incorporating the salsa into another recipe. One reviewer mentioned adding garlic. Very good tip! Like most recipes, this one is a great base with which to experiment and make one's own.
Yummy Great way to use up some fresh tomatoes etc. Simple easy I definitely like that! Also simple to add anything extra you like in your salsa.
This fresh salsa was so easy and AMAZING! I just made the basic version. Will add a little garlic and fresh avocado next time.
I've made this several times; this time I doubled the recipe using 8 of my home grown tomatoes, added 4 cloves of crushed garlic and probably 6 teaspoons of lime juice. Absolutely delish!!

Delicious, I put salsa on all my main dishes and side dishes. I will make this forever. Always make sure to use plum tomatoes, purple onions, fresh cilantro, lots of lime, salt and favorite hot sauce. That’s my way of making it. Yummy!!!!
Very nice. I used a Jalapeno instead of the Serranos. Simple recipe. I usually do something more complex, with seasonings and such.
It was a big hit at the party!!! They said it was the best salsa they had ever had!!!
Love it! I added some Garlic and used some spicier chillies. It's my favorite Salsa to make.
omit serrano chilies & replace with poblano or jalapeno chilies!!
It was amazing but I did my own gpas recipe

The salsa is wonderful!!! I do add some garlic to it though. I've made this many times and now I have the taste test down. What's great about this recipe is that if you have leftover black beans and/or corn they both are great mixed in. I usually will start with just the salsa and then decide that I could make it last a little longer if I put in the leftover beans or corn off the cob. Yummmmm.......

Love Salsa!!! On the way home from picking up catnip for my kitties I stopped and purchased lots of tomatoes. I followed this receipe as written and was not sorry. There was very little left at the end of the meal. Last night (really this morning) just before 1:00 am I ate what remained - good grief I wanted the 'good stuff' all to myself. Oh well I loved the salsa and didn't want it to go to waste. Yippee....
Looks like pico de gallo..
Good, fresh, basic salsa. Exactly what I was looking for.

This a nice fresh salsa, written as is, and a great base recipe for building. I chose to use a couple different peppers, added some paste, minced garlic and tossed in some red pepper flakes. My peppers are on the very hot end of the spectrum, so additional fresh lime. Tastes great right after making, so I know as it sits, the flavors are going to explode further.
Good recipe. However, I only used 2 Serrano peppers instead of 5 as my husband likes a milder flavor.
This salsa was fantastic! We made it for a community event and it was a hit! Only downside is it did not save very well for the next day, not that there was much leftover!

You said to add half an onion. I added half a red onion. Yuk!!! Too much onion. It would have been better not to have any onion in my opinion. Now I guess I can cut this salsa with some cans of diced tomatoes and still salvage it. Try again partner.

I used a pint of (sliced in half) cherry tomatoes from garden instead of larger type, added juice from 1 fresh lime - 1/4 cup chopped green onions and pulsed everything a couple of times in food processor. It was great and everyone loved it. Great way to use up all those garden tomatoes.
Made two batches both with added garlic clove. One with milder peppers one with 4 Serrano peppers and only my son really enjoyed that one.

I made this to use up too many summer tomatoes and gave 2 jars to my daughter and son in law. Got a text later that day, "Dude, this salsa is so good! We already ate a jar" I never get compliments. I made it with one chili, as the baby is breastfeeding. Also put in a little fresh garlic, as suggested by many. I made it again for the neighbors with red onion and it was really good. You can put this on chicken, fish or an omelette with avocado if you are vegetarian, and I think you can probably add mango, pineapple, cucumbers or whatever? I also chopped the tomatoes over a strainer and bowl, to control the juiciness, as they were juicy . My favorite summer recipe now.

Roma tomatoes chopped chunky
White onion diced
Cilantro
Lime juice 
Perfect & health & easy
You will never buy store bought again
Wow! This is a very tasty recipe. As other reviewers suggested I used 1 pepper and added 3 cloves of garlic. Even my husband who doesn't like onions loved this salsa.
It's really good! Very spicy! Does need the garlic, and has excellent flavor!
Best salsa ever! Everyone loves it. I do however, reduce the serrano peppers to one large one or two small ones. The rest is excellent!

Great base. i have made this several times and it is always a hit. I made it as is once and it was way too hot. Then I made it with 6 Roma tomatoes. Really great. Then I made it with half a clove of garlic. It was fantastic.
Delicious!!!!!!

I was feeling lazy and didn't have any serranos on hand, so I threw everything into the Vita Mixer, subbed serranos for one unseeded jalapeño, and added a garlic clove. Pretty delicious for 45 seconds of work.

I kept getting tomatoes in my weekly co-op share and this worked out great to use them up. However, I did change it a bit for my taste. First - I don't know on what planet 3 Serrano peppers would work unless they were completely cleaned of all seeds and membrane. I used 1 with half its seeds and membrane and got the perfect punch. Also did about 2 tablespoons of lime juice and added a garlic clove. Pulsed in food processor til it resembled chunky salsa. 3 large tomatoes and half an onion and fistful of cilantro made 32 ozs.

This is a great salsa recipe. Tastes fresh and is fairly easy. I only used 3 serrano peppers though, any more than that and it would have been way too spicy for me, but not for some one who loves spicy food.
FANTASTIC! I only used 3 1/2 of the peppers and doubled everything else (tomatoes, onions, cilantro, lime) I also added real garlic

I did not make this recipe, but for those who think there may be an error with the # of peppers apparently have not watched the video. The video instructions say to remove seeds and membranes. Hope this helps some of those having trouble. Hope to try soon.
I added 9 tomatoes.if made a quart. I did add some more lime juice 1 more teaspoon. It is very hot but I added peppers that were fresh crushed last year

I made this with the 5 serrano peppers as suggested and it was very HOT. I thought it was delicious but others that I served it to thought it was way too hot. My suggestion would be to make it with 2 or 3 serrano peppers if you can't take the heat. Remember, you can always add more peppers to increase the heat.
I cut everything very small and wow! It was really something special!

This is a great recipe. My only adjustment was using jalapeño peppers instead of Serrano chilies. I only used 1-2 peppers depending on how spicy I wanted it. Overall its a great recipe and tastes a lot like what you would get at chipotle.

I made sure to trim the ribs (white interior spines) of the pepper, so it wouldn't be overwhelmingly spicy. I couldn't wait an hour and set on the salsa within 15 minutes. I also used diced grape tomatoes, fresh dried cilantro from a jar (Litehouse brand) and the juice of 1 lime. Delish!!!
Easy and so tasty. Five peppers are a little too hot for me, but otherwise it's terrific.
It doesn't get any easier or fresher than this!

made enough for two batches made it with the dried cilantro made one with fresh jalapenos for my husband and mom-in-law and one without I put the garlic cloves in there was really good saved this to make agian

I picked this recipe because it was so simple. I did take the advice of the other reviewers and only used 2 peppers (took seeds out) and added a bit of garlic. I also bumped up the salt, just a wee bit because it needed a little something extra. I only had roma tomatoes, and found that I basically had to double the amount of tomatoes because it looked like cilantro salsa! I did not even wait to chill it, started eating it right away. Have it in the fridge right now, bet it tastes even better after it is chilled. Enjoy!
Good. The way I prefer to make it is a bit different because we find the cilantro to be overpowering.
I have been making this every weekend. Great on grilled chicken and in salads or just chips so fresh and healthy.
I did add a bit of sugar and a bit of vinegar .... I served it over my Mahi Mahi tacos and everyone Love it!
Awesome salsa recipe, my family loved it! Next time I may dice smaller or even purée part or all to see how it turns out.
Very fresh! Although very salty. I measured out 1/4 tsp salt initially, then added more as I tasted.
I tried 2 recipes and this one I liked more. The only changes I would make though, is to reduce the cilantro, add garlic, and add the chilies to taste. I will definitely make this again.
This recipe was a big hit, enjoyed by all
I substituted with jalapeno peppers, I love Lemon and lime but for some reason I don't like it in my salsa (go figure) other than that it was good.

love the recipe! I used small tomatoes because we had so many (not cherry, but larger). Bought a tube of cilantro paste from the store and it worked out very good actually. and then just regular jalapeno peppers. Was delicious on taco salad!

Absolutely love it! Awesome recipe as a starter for all of us who are new to making salsa. I was able to tweak it to several different recipes just by adding things I and my hubby like. Very pleased and will continue to use for all time!

Tried it today and it's pretty good (with homegrown tomatoes). I did follow a couple of advice from one person: I blanched onions and garlic and I added EVOO (Extra Virgin Olive Oil). I will do again! Thx for sharing :)
This is a great basic recipe. I suggest letting it sit in the fridge for at least 12 hours before serving.

onion/cilantro amts are good, just use 3 ROMA tomatoes, and one medium sized regular tomato- just the sidewalls (no juice/seeds/guts), and be sure to add clove of garlic, a bit more salt & lime juice, and some olive oil and WHITE VINEGAR (approx 1 tsp oil, 2 tsp vinegar). none of the other reviews i saw (went 20 in or so) mentioned vinegar, which kicks up all the flavors like salt does. also makes it last longer. oh...and the no brainer: throw all this in a blender/food processor if you really want salsa, otherwise, you have something between pico de gallo and chunky tomato something :)
Tasty!! I put mine in the food processor and did a pulse or two and turned out fabulous!! I also added some fresh garlic.

I love this recipie- VERY good!
One time I made it and forgot salt, makes a BIG difference!
also- for those who don't like spice- did you know that the seeds are the spicy part of the chile? Take em' out and you're good!
Thanks to all who review recipies- helps a lot!

The recipe is simple and has potential. Healthy, quick and should've been tasty. However, there is an excessive amount of salt. It really only needs half the amount listed or less. The peppers are intense too. I put 3 in instead of 5 and its still got an powerful kick. Obviously the peppers are dependent on your personal preference, but that is not noted in the recipe. I think if you called this Intense Salsa it would be a much better name.
I have a lot of tomatoes from local farms market. And this is best a simplest salsa I have taste it..Thank you for sharing
I was nervous about all the peppers, but it tastes really good! Next time I will try adding some fresh garlic.

I'm being generous with my two star rating for this recipe if prepared as written. It's very good with significant tweaking, but by the time you get done doing so it isn't even the same recipe. First off, I cut waaaay back on the serranos - obviously. And I used jalapenos rather than serranos. I wanted to be able to taste this, and you wouldn't be able to if your mouth was numb. Secondly, in my view 1/2 c. each of both onion and cilantro and onion was far too much. It tasted like, well, cilantro and onion. I needed to add more tomato (which I seeded and chopped) to get the balance I thought was right. This recipe, then, is a good reference tool if you're wondering what the ingredients in fresh salsa are - but not for measurements. Make this recipe as written at your own risk. Make a couple of reasonable changes and you've got a fine salsa.
This was good as written. It was one of the best things we made for our appetizer dinner. Simple and delish!
Good falvor.Yummy.............
Excellent zippy fresh taste. We enjoy this salsa in our omelets.
Super easy and good! I only put in 3 serrano peppers and people thought it was just right!
Followed the recipe exactly except tripled it and my husband and I loved it. It was devoured in two sittings.
Perfect!!!!
Too much cilantro for the amount of tomatoes. Tasty but overwhelming.

I really enjoyed this salsa. Love the flavors! I used one Serrano pepper and one Fresno pepper, and that was the right amount of heat. Hot, but not unbearable... Made this in the food processor. (First chopped tomatoes and a small green pepper and put them in a small bowl. Then, chopped the cilantro, onion, and hot peppers. Finally, I mixed everything together. Oh, and I used sea salt...) I will definitely use this salsa again!

I don't usually review recipes, but this salsa is so easy and delicious. The only change I made to this was recipe to add 1-2 cloves of garlic. I also omitted the onions and used onion powder instead (personal preference). Definitely will be making this again!
I put this in my food processor and it was easy for scooping and just lovely!

This went over very well at work. After reading reviews I made the following alterations - I added 1 t. sugar, 1 t. olive oil, a large clove of garlic. I also put the chopped tomatoes in a strainer to let a little of the water drain off (about a t.). 3 serrano peppers with seeds seems to be the optimal number. You can somewhat get a sense once they're chopped up how hot they will be by how hot they smell.
I added 3 garlic cloves and I was out of serrano peppers & lime juice so I used 1 jalapeno pepper & 1/2 tsp hot sauce and lemon juice instead. 1/2 tsp salt was enough. Husband loved it.
Absolutely delicious!
Waaay too many chiles!

This salsa was so good! Loved it! Be careful with the serrano chiles, though. Thanks to other reviewers, I was careful and tasted a small piece of chile first. My serrano chile pepper was so hot that I only needed to use one pepper (seeds removed), and I chopped it into very small pieces. I love spicy salsa, and this was definitely spicy enough with just one chile. I served the salsa as a topping for fish and white rice, and it was delicious! My family & I decided next time we'll make fish tacos and add some black beans & shredded cheese! Mmmmm!

Yummy! I used Jalapeno peppers since that is what I had in my garden, and a sweet white onion because that's what I had in my veggie drawer! Since I was serving it AS dinner one night, I added half a cup of black beans to about 3 big spoonfuls of the salsa and served with tortilla chips. It made me happy!

This is so yummy, I could make and then eat a whole batch by myself! My tomato bushes went hog-wild this year, so I've been looking for ways to use them and this is one of the best I've found. Thanks!
excellent, but one and half Serranos was enough heat!

To those who think that this recipe is to hot remember that chili peppers have a different heat level in different region of the country for example I lived in California for a few years and ate jalapeños every day and they were perfectly hot for me then moved to Indiana and the same peppers there are insanely hot, this goes for serranos also. Just goes to show that peppers from other areas can be hotter or milder. Also the smaller the pepper the hotter it will be. If unsure cut the pepper in half cross ways and touch lightly to your lip you will then know the heat level of the pepper in question.

To those who think that this recipe is to hot remember that chili peppers have a different heat level in different region of the country for example I lived in California for a few years and ate jalapeños every day and they were perfectly hot for me then moved to Indiana and the same peppers there are insanely hot, this goes for serranos also. Just goes to show that peppers from other areas can be hotter or milder. Also the smaller the pepper the hotter it will be. If unsure cut the pepper in half cross ways and touch lightly to your lip you will then know the heat level of the pepper in question.

I've made this recipe many times and it's excellent. So fresh and not overdone. Pure, clean, fresh flavour. 

The only thing I adjust is 5 serrano peppers is WAY too much. I usually make it with 2. Once I used 3 and we could barely eat it, and we like hot. Also, you MUST remove the seeds from the peppers, and I strongly suggest wearing disposable gloves when chopping the peppers. Serrano chiles are required. Jalapenos do not give the same flavour or heat.

Does not keep long. Best if consumed the day it is made.
Delicious and easy! As others suggested, I added a clove of garlic, and I skipped the cilantro because I generally dislike the flavor. I got lots of compliments!

This is exactly the ratio of ingredients I have been looking for! I've been tinkering with my salsa recipe for a couple of years now - and apparently the jalapenos were a big part of the problem. The serranos make all the difference - although, I can't quite bring myself to try the full 5, 2.5 works just fine for me.

Oh my, this is GREAT! 6-Stars. Thank you so much. It was much tastier the next morning after chilling overninght. I added a tablespoon of olive oil and a teaspoon of salt and one of sugar and cut back a little on the cilantro (personal taste) and used ten roma tomatoes. These additions mellows it out a bit and the oil enhances the flavors. It still has a great bite.
-
What a great stand-alone or base recipe for customizing. Lots of liquid. Great to chase down your morning eggs with. 
-
Next batch I'll seed the tomatoes and use jalapenos for a milder version. Thanks again.
